review:
Our Pregnancy Journey with support of Dr Manjula Patil @ Motherhood from 26.5 weeks to 34.3 weeks.

 We were pregnant with twins and were in 26.6 weeks running, everything was going well until we had appointment in my regular hospital for regular check up. During scan our doctor noticed she could see some membrane it‚Äôs seems, which was sign of cervix might be got open. Hence for expert advice we got referred to Dr Manjula Patil at Motherhood hospital HRBR layout. Over there during scan and investigation she found my wife cervix was completely opened and doctor was able to see membrane. It seemed both babies were okay and around 900 gm weight by then but the challenge was if the cervix kept it can be ruptured anytime which will lead to premature delivery.

Dr Manjula madam explained all the details and pros and cons about the surgery. So now the only option was left to stich the cervix by pushing the babies inside which itself was great risk and chances of success was less than 5%. We didn‚Äôt had much options so in order to save the little ones from premature delivery which itself was great risk for their survival. Anyhow we decided to go as per Dr Manjula advice for cervical stitches. There was also high chance during the cervical stitch procedure babies could push back and which would lead to emergency C-section. 

Dr Manjula Mam took the heroic stand and was successfully able to push the babies inside and stitched the cervix. Post which my wife was kept under observation for 48hrs, and when everything was normal we were allowed to go home. 

From here on the journey was more tough everyday was like a bonus for us and every week was like a milestone. At home my wife was on completely bed rest and was only allowed to get up for bathroom use.

Days went slow from here on, after completing 30 weeks we had a scan and everything was found normal and baby growth was also good. Babies weight was around 1.5 kg. 

We reached 32 weeks, which was the minimum target set by the doctor, both babies were doing good.

Staring 34 weeks my wife started feeling more pain and discomfort, back was also started hurting during sleep. During the regular visit Dr Manjula checked and found the cervix was barely trying to hold the pressure. So she updated it was time for delivery. 

On 22nd March we got admitted and on 23rd March we are blessed with twins baby girls !! First baby weight 2.2 kg and second baby 2.3 kg. Both babies and mother are doing good, for observation both babies were kept in NICU. 

From NICU One baby was handed over after 24 hrs monitoring and another one after 36 hrs. Both the babies are healthy and doing good now. This miracle journey for our babies wouldn‚Äôt been possible without support of Dr Manjula Patil !! 

Me and my entire family is very grateful to Dr. Manjula Mam for her support and giving new lives to our babies. We had a very remarkable experience with Motherhood. We want to thank each and every staff of motherhood for their dedication and support.
